Introduction
Tech Innovators Inc. is committed to protecting the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of its data and resources hosted on Microsoft Azure. This security policy outlines the measures and procedures to ensure the secure deployment, management, and usage of Azure services. This policy applies to all employees, contractors, and third-party vendors who interact with Tech Innovators Inc.'s Azure cloud services.
Scope
This policy covers all Azure services utilized by Tech Innovators Inc., including but not limited to:
Azure Virtual Machines (VMs)
Azure Storage
Azure SQL Database
Azure App Services
Azure Active Directory (AD)
Azure Key Vault
Access Control
3.1 User Authentication
Azure Active Directory (AD) must be used for identity and access management.
Multi-factor authentication (MFA) is mandatory for accessing all Azure services.
Strong password policies must be enforced through Azure AD, requiring passwords to be a minimum of 12 characters with a mix of uppercase, lowercase, numeric, and special characters.
3.2 User Authorization
Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) must be implemented to grant permissions based on job roles, following the principle of least privilege.
Access reviews must be conducted quarterly to ensure user permissions are appropriate and up-to-date.
Azure Resource Configuration
4.1 Secure Configuration
Azure Security Center must be used to continuously assess and secure Azure resources.
Azure Policy must be utilized to enforce compliance with security configurations and standards.
All VMs must have Azure Disk Encryption enabled to protect data at rest.
4.2 Monitoring and Logging
Azure Monitor and Azure Log Analytics must be enabled to collect, analyze, and act on telemetry data from Azure resources.
Activity logs must be retained for a minimum of one year and reviewed regularly to detect and respond to security incidents.
Data Protection
5.1 Data Encryption
All data stored in Azure Storage and Azure SQL Database must be encrypted using Azure-managed keys or customer-managed keys stored in Azure Key Vault.
Encryption in transit must be enforced using TLS 1.2 or higher for all communications.
5.2 Data Backup and Recovery
Azure Backup must be used to perform regular backups of critical data and resources.
Backup data must be encrypted and stored in a different region to ensure protection in case of a disaster.
Periodic restoration tests must be conducted to ensure data can be recovered effectively.
Network Security
6.1 Virtual Network Configuration
Azure Virtual Networks (VNets) must be used to segment and isolate Azure resources.
Network Security Groups (NSGs) must be configured to control inbound and outbound traffic to Azure resources based on defined security rules.
6.2 Perimeter Defense
Azure Firewall and Azure DDoS Protection must be implemented to protect against external threats and attacks.
VPN gateways or Azure ExpressRoute must be used for secure connections between on-premise networks and Azure.
Incident Response
7.1 Incident Detection
Azure Security Center must be configured to alert on potential security incidents and vulnerabilities.
Automated playbooks in Azure Sentinel must be used for incident response and remediation.
7.2 Incident Management
A cloud-specific incident response plan must be developed and maintained, detailing procedures for identifying, responding to, and recovering from Azure security incidents.
The incident response plan must be tested regularly to ensure effectiveness.
Compliance and Regulatory Requirements
All Azure resources must comply with relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards, including data protection regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).
Compliance audits must be conducted regularly to verify adherence to legal and regulatory requirements.
Security Training and Awareness
Employees must receive regular training on Azure security best practices, including the proper use of Azure services and identification of potential security threats.
Specialized training must be provided for staff involved in managing and securing Azure environments.
10. Policy Enforcement and Review
10.1 Compliance Monitoring
Compliance with this policy must be monitored continuously through Azure Security Center and other automated tools.
Any violations of this policy must be documented and addressed promptly, with corrective actions taken as necessary.
10.2 Policy Review
This policy must be reviewed and updated at least annually or as needed to address changes in technology, business requirements, and emerging security threats.
